content.description: The supply schedule gives two points on a market supply curve.
content.question: Price Quantity Supplied <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following is true about the supply curve between the given points?

choices.label: The supply curve is inelastic, because the percentage change in the price is greater than the percentage change in the quantity supplied.

The supply curve is unit elastic, because the change in price is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the change in quantity supplied is <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.

The supply curve is perfectly elastic, because the change in price is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the change in quantity supplied is <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
The supply curve is elastic, because the price elasticity of supply is equal to <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The supply curve is unit elastic, because the price elasticity of supply is equal to <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The supply curve is inelastic, because the percentage change in the price is greater than the percentage change in the quantity supplied.
